intro: Chaenorhinum origanifolium var. degenii, commonly known as the Degen's chaenorhinum, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a distinct aromatic scent, reminiscent of oregano. This variety is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique morphology and ecological preferences make it a notable species within its native habitat.
